conclusion: Use properties of ideal gas and p-V diagram to find work done from state B to state C
State A: p_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 2 x 10^-3 m^3; State B: p_B = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 2 x 10^-3 m^3; State C: p_C = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3
Temperature at state A, T_A = 27°C = 300 K
Use ratio of products of pressure and volume to find temperature at state A
Need to find T_B first using area under p-V curve for process
Work done from A to B: W_AB = ∫ p dV
Area under curve AB is a triangle: W_AB = 1/2 x p_A x (V_B - V_A) = 0 J
Temperature is constant for isobaric process BC
Work done in isobaric process: W_BC = p_B x (V_C - V_B)
Substitute values: W_BC = 2 x 10^5 x (3 x 10^-3 - 2 x 10^-3) = 200 J
Conclusion: Work done by gas from state B to state C is 200 J
